title: New lag makes the game unplayable.
body:
I don't know what happened between games last night.  I played several games lag free as normal, queued up another and have had 150-300 ping ever since, and the game will freeze for .25 - .5 seconds.  Apparently I have at least 8% packet loss.

I'm on campus internet in Kansas(so I don't control the modem or anything), don't stream, and live alone.  Nothing has changed with my firewall.  I reinstalled the game, still have the problem.

replies.body: Update: Tried the Hextech Repair Tool, no change.

Thanks for trying the HRT!  It seems like you might have a weak connection reaching the game server which is causing these lag spikes and packet loss.  It's hard to say if this might be result of being on campus or routing, but we can dig a little deeper to find out.  Grab the logs that HRT automatically creates for you, and attach it to a [player support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) ticket.  Our tech team can help you out further, and will respond as soon as possible!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=KsuL4Xd8,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-07-30T16:39:39.034+0000)
>
> Thanks for trying the HRT!  It seems like you might have a weak connection reaching the game server which is causing these lag spikes and packet loss. Grab the logs that HRT automatically creates for you, and attach it to a [player support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) ticket.  Our tech team can help you out further, and will respond as soon as possible!

Thanks for the response.  I remember it saying after the scan that it created a log file on my desktop, but there isn't anything there.  Could it have been created somewhere else?  Or should I run it again?

Edit: The folder appeared after reopening the HRT, and then disappeared after the scan completed.

Edit2: I managed to copy the folder during a new scan, so that's all set.

Indeed, you will find a Zip folder named "LoL Logs" which will contain those files.  If you were unable to locate it, there's not harm in running it again.  If nothing comes up, the logs can also be obtained individually:

[Network Analysis](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq1)
[Network Information Log](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq4)
[Process List](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq3)

Hope that helps!
